customer_addr:
28-10 36th Ave, FL 1
Long Island City, NY 11106

citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, the licensee did not provide APHIS 7006 disposition records for 7 dogs sold since their last
inspection. Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracing forward
and trace back of the animals. Accurate and complete records of animals on hand, acquisition, and disposition need to be
available at the time of inspections. Correct by 5/26/2023.

The kennel for “Clifford’s,” microchip# 70000000100278 had generalized flaking rust on the metal bars. Hair and organic
material were stuck on the areas with rust. Rust can prevent proper cleaning and sanitization of primary enclosures, as
well as lead to damage to the structural integrity. Interior surfaces and any surfaces that come in contact with dogs must
be free of excessive rust. Correct by 6/1/22.

Two primary enclosures contained damaged floors. The floor tray for “Ben’s,” microchip# 900215002445098, primary
enclosure had a jagged-edged deficit that spanned the entire front of the kennel. The floor tray for “Clifford’s,” microchip#
70000000100278, primary enclosure had a jagged-edged deficit in the front of the kennel that was approximately 12
inches by 6 inches. Failure to maintain primary enclosures can allow for holes or sharp points which can result in injury,
entrapment, or escape of the animals. Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by 6/1/22.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
At the time of inspection, the licensee did not provide APHIS 7006 disposition records for 7 dogs sold since their last 
inspection. Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals is essential for proper identification, tracing forward 
and trace back of the animals. Accurate and complete records of animals on hand, acquisition, and disposition need to be 
available at the time of inspections. Correct by 5/26/2023. 
3.1(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The kennel for “Clifford’s,” microchip# 70000000100278 had generalized flaking rust on the metal bars. Hair and organic 
material were stuck on the areas with rust. Rust can prevent proper cleaning and sanitization of primary enclosures, as 
well as lead to damage to the structural integrity. Interior surfaces and any surfaces that come in contact with dogs must 
be free of excessive rust. Correct by 6/1/22. 
3.6(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Two primary enclosures contained damaged floors. The floor tray for “Ben’s,” microchip# 900215002445098, primary 
enclosure had a jagged-edged deficit that spanned the entire front of the kennel. The floor tray for “Clifford’s,” microchip# 
70000000100278, primary enclosure had a jagged-edged deficit in the front of the kennel that was approximately 12

inches by 6 inches. Failure to maintain primary enclosures can allow for holes or sharp points which can result in injury, 
entrapment, or escape of the animals. Primary enclosures must be kept in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
Correct by 6/1/22. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
